abstract: Roster of nations seeking out tax evaders based on Panama Papers, major leak of secret documents from Mossack Fonseca law firm, continues to grow but experts say prospect of long-term reform in shadowy world of offshore finance may be dim; United States serves as example, as states with stake in lucrative corporate registration business are likely to resist serious changes, and Congress appears unlikely to act anytime soon on comprehensive reform bills.
lead_paragraph: Action has been taken around the world in response to the disclosures, but the lucrative corporate registration business is likely to resist major change.

headline.main: Panama Papers May Inspire More Big Leaks, if Not Reform
headline.print_headline: Panama Papers May Fuel  Big Leaks, if Not Reform

snippet: Action has been taken around the world in response to the disclosures, but the lucrative corporate registration business is likely to resist major change.
